data.name: Hypercerts
data.description:
This round aims to strengthen the Hypercerts Ecosystem to realize the vision of an interconnected impact funding network. We specifically want to support projects
1. that integrate hypercerts into existing funding platforms—similar to the hypercerts integration with Gitcoin,
2. that develop new applications like prize competitions leveraging the hypercerts infrastructure,
3. that build tooling to extent the functionality for multiple integrations and applications, such as Deresy to coordinate evaluators, or
4. that are tangible use cases piloting new functionalities, e.g. implementing retroactive funding rounds with hypercerts or using hyperboards.
Registration of VoiceDeck as the host entity of the open source repo for an impact certificates marketplace
data.title: Incorporation of VoiceDeck

data.name: OpenCivics
data.description:
This OpenCivics Consortium Round seeks to fund critical collaborative protocols, prototypes, and infrastructures that enable civic engagement and interoperable civic utilities for direct governance and stewardship of our communities and commons. We see these collaborative methods and prototypes as critically underfunded force multipliers for multi-agent coordination on key systemic leverage points that create deep social change. 

Ideal applicants will be engaged in developing technology, applied research, and social processes related to collaboration and coordination for collective action. Projects may address the diverse stack of collaborative protocols needed for successful multi-agent coordination such as: identity and attestation, on-chain delegation and roles, decentralized project management, fundraising and allocation, systems-aware strategic alignment processes, measurement and evaluation, and participatory governance and learning. These efforts may be theoretical and research-based or may be applied contexts of collaboration whose successful actualization could lead to protocolization of key activities and collaborative functions.  

For additional definitions and application details, please visit https://go.opencivics.co/wiki

questions.query: What is the desired impact you seek to create through your research, (ie what becomes possible for communities as the result of the research you conduct?)
questions.explanation:
Our goal is researching a specific question: are impact certificates tax deductible?

The IRS rules are no quid pro quo contribution - so donating to wikipedia is fine, but purchasing their mug or any merch bears tax

If donors get impact certificates in exchange for their contributions, is it quid pro quo? 

Tax deductions are table stakes for ensuring foundations can support your project, so if impact certificates do not qualify for those our TAM becomes smaller.

With  $1000, we can formulate the research question and get quotations from lawyers on researching tax deductible impact certificates.

For $3000-$6000 we will get a formal legal opinion that can be shared with the community on structuring a retroactive funding system based on impact certificates that can be tax deductible.

questions.query: Please describe your past history conducting research of this nature or the relevant skills that will support your work.
questions.explanation:
I have just completed a major research output with financial support from the last round of opencivics funding - acceptance of our litepaper at ACM CSCW, due for being published in November this year.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xPzQnK1bullhLc2VwYbWFdhaqR9a-NQF

I have also obtained legal opinions from lawyers in the past for questions around fair use.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mvv_9giyhbBJkNnD_P_P1O5EQVIJCECs

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
questions.explanation: https://github.com/VoiceDeck

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: In GG20-21 took part in dapps OSS core round, hypercerts and open civics community round with the same profile.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
We are one of the earliest projects building on top of the open source protocol Hypercerts (a standard for impact certificates). We expand its ecosystem in 3 ways:

1. A good looking and open source front end or UI where customers can purchase hypercerts and which developers can build on for their own hypercerts application

2. Working with web2 nonprofits for bringing their private database of impact as onchain hypercerts on optimism

3. A new model for evaluating hypercerts where we come up with impact scores based on calculating each certificates SROI (using the relentless monetization technique by Robin Hood foundation in NY)

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Social impact bonds or pay for performance contracts require high upfront setup costs and a donor with deep pockets willing to pay for outcomes.

Our dapp expands outcome funding instruments to retail donors, by letting them purchase hypercerts of impactful work as an accountable way to fund social enterprises.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
Using funds raised in the earlier GG rounds, we have launched our platform using impact certificates from the  database of the civic participation organization Video Volunteers.

We will use the funds to create a v2, drive sales from donors towards these certificates, integrate credit card payments and increase the number of organizations willing to record their outcomes onchain.

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

**For GG21 we aim to strengthen the community building and operational capacity of [FrontierDAO](https://frontierdao.xyz) as it relates to our climate and fusion energy initiatives.**

The primary focus for this quarter is reaching out to the wider Climate+Web3+QF community about our collaboration with the XPrize Foundation on designing FusionX - an in-the-works prize competition by the XPrize Foundation.

**Executive Member Paige Donner's design proposal was accepted in a public call and competition for upcoming Xprize challenge designs - this one is for Climate and Energy Abundance. She was contacted by the Climate & Energy Program Director of XPrize to further develop this initiative in consultation.**


                                            🫵🏼🌱

As we go further along in this process, our aim is to get early involvement from the wider Climate/QF/Web3 ecosystem so as to foster a sense of involvement by all you Truly Amazing ReGens!! in the process and share a sense of stakeholdership as this develops.

                                           🌎🌏🌍
For the past 2 quarters (Q1 2024 & Q2 2024) we have

been 'like ducks'🦆🦆 - Treading water with 100% effort below the surface while we seemingly skim nonchalantly through the larger blockchain ecosystems.

For the past 6 months, much intention and energy has been put into building out Frontier Registry which is an adjacent project to FrontierDAO and sits squarely in #openscience , #DePin, #IP and #Data. We even received some DARPA (defense advanced research projects agency) recognition for it back in April. Please refer to Paige's recent LinkedIn posts for detailed updates.

                                  🐦‍🔥🔥🔥🔥🐦‍🔥
Within our specific verticals of climate and fusion energy, we have undertaken several distinct outreach programs to welcome people into our ecosystem and provide basic knowledge about:

✔️- fusion energy

✔️- energy justice

✔️- web3 tooling

✔️- science on the blockchain

Conversely, as we outreach in traditional orgs, academia and research institutions, we have been doing significant public awareness and public information campaigning about Quadratic Funding and how this impacts and supports project funding.

☑️Quadratic Funding

☑️ Vonation

☑️Transparency for DePIN funding

We are also successfully navigating the matrix between the worlds of traditional academia in the context of STEM and a more web3 approach aka DeSci.

Informed communities are vital. And we are aiming for our FrontierDAO community members as well as our larger QF ReGen + DePin Frens to be the most well-informed citizenry as possible about the promises fusion energy holds for the planet.

                                       ✅💯♻
The aim here is to provide sustenance and ongoing sustainability for core public information outreach operations of the DAO for this particular initiative. In conjunction with collaborating with the XPrize Foundation on a challenge design, our current projects are XKind, the courses that are being developed to provide cohorts of learners the means by which to understand the basics of:

✅What is Fusion Energy and why is it an exponentially transformative technology?

✅How does science fit on the blockchain?

✅How does one easily access and use the blockchain even if you're not tech savvy (web3 wallets 101)?

✅How does QF work?

✅How can I get involved in an XPrize Challenge even if I just want to support and not necessarily be a contender?

And more basic and fundamentally good questions about fusion energy and clean energy technologies.

                🤸‍♀️🤸‍♂️🤾‍♂️🤾‍♀️🚴‍♂️🏄‍♂️🧘‍♂️🏌️‍♂️🧘‍♀️🏊‍♂️
data.title: FrontierDAO

questions.query: How should the success of your grant be measured?
questions.explanation: Number of grassroots citizenry participating in the upcoming Abundant Energy XPrize competition and voting to help determine the outcome.  Up to 100,000 = Success;  Up to 500,000 = Massive Catalyst; Up to 1 Million = Game Changer

questions.query: What is the intended direct impact your project will have on the ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Raise engagement and awareness within the Web3 community in fusion energy as a clean, abundant energy source.

questions.query: What is the long-term impact of your grant?
questions.explanation: We hope to have at least 1 million grassroots citizen participants in the Climate and Abundant Energy XPrize competition to vote and help determine the prize outcomes.  The timeline is 3 - 5 years.

questions.query: How will the grant funds be used?
questions.explanation: We are at pre-stage of collaborating on this competition design. We will build on the series of 10 workshops about DeSci, Open Science and Fusion Energy that we already broadcast via Zoom. We will create a mini-course out of these to help people walk through the subject of fusion energy.

questions.query: What is the timeframe for the work funded?
questions.explanation: 6 months.

questions.query: How will receiving a grant enable you to foster growth or innovation within the ecosystem?
questions.explanation: We are still on the ground level of raising awareness and engagement in fusion energy as a clean energy technology so any outreach and DAO development we can do adds to the momentum of what we're building towards.  Likewise, any demonstrations we can do with Quadratic Funding and Quadratic Voting for established prize competitions such as this one will help to establish this method as viable, functional and efficient.

data.title: Mini Course - 5 Modules - Clean Abundant Fusion Energy
data.description: From previously recorded workshops, we will put together a 5 module self-paced mini-course on fusion energy and the Super Abundance of Energy it promises.

data.reason:
**The Course is live now and available for anyone to join. **

It's self-paced and requires about 4 - 4.5 hours to complete all 5 Modules, 16 lessons.

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation:
VoiceDeck has taken part in hypercerts and open civics community rounds

We have also been in the core rounds since the gitcoin beta round

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
1. VoiceDeck is one of the flagship open source dapps built on the hypercerts standard, leading the charge in figuring out new ways of outcome based funding onchain

2. The GainForest team forked the VoiceDeck app to launch their own marketplace for hypercerts in the environmental domain. They even have a GG23 community round for people to quadratically fund their ecocerts!

3. Broadly, outcome based funding should become a norm for funding open source software. By creating this funding mechanism, we can apply lessons learnt back to the OSS ecosystem.

For example, deepfunding.org is an initiative to fund the core ethereum dependencies with AI. It is a spin out from VoiceDeck based on smarter ways of quantifying impact of open source repos.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
1. We are seeing a movement towards quantifying impact, especially with the help of AI. VoiceDeck is unique in quantifying all the outcomes that are sold on the app.voicedeck.org marketplace. Generally, it is easier to quantify past outcomes than prospective future work.

2. VoiceDeck has a clear path to integrating organizations and communities into web3: record your past impact onchain so that it cannot be sold multiple times.

Reward these outcomes to support its creators to do more impactful work.

3. VoiceDeck is also innovative in linking web2 and web3. We recently integrated credit card payments into our marketplace, expanding the target base to those outside web3.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
Our main focus now is connecting the accountability that comes from retroactive funding with the excitement of funding future impact.

We want to modify our CMS to accept not just past impact but also first information reports that have a high chance of converting to impact in the near term.

So we would use grant funds to record such stories, get an action team to work on their conversion to some outcome and then point to the tangible civic impact achieved in the next gitcoin round
